channel.title: Labtop screen messed up
channel.description: Now i was playing xbox yesterday and my labtop was perfect...was jamming out with my tunes and stuff, yet i had to go to bed for school. then I came and decide to come on to moparscape to check out some stuff when I saw my labtop screen was messed up it looked like this [img]http://oi51.tinypic.com/2na3589.jpg[/img] yet the black spot was smaller and so I'm wondering if it will go back to normal if i leave it off for a few days or will i need to get it fix or just get a new labtop

item.title: Labtop screen messed up
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:13, topic:474361”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=592303.msg4183808#msg4183808 date=1355870616]
If you’re gonna decide to repair it, don’t take it somewhere as they’ll charge you about 250% what it actually costs, a new laptop LCD is only around £50, even my non-technical brother managed to replace it with his last month.
[/quote]

Is this good place to buy it
http://www.amazon.com/dp/B009P7GDP0/ref=asc_df_B009P7GDP02307240?smid=A20FSQL9O0VS6G&tag=dealtmp3724-20&linkCode=asn&creative=395105&creativeASIN=B009P7GDP0[/quote]
Sure, that’s where I got mine. Just make sure you get the same one as the current laptop

Read full topic

item.title: Labtop screen messed up
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

If you have an extra computer screen laying around, you could plug it into your laptop and use that as a screen. You could also use a TV screen (if it has the input available).

item.title: Labtop screen messed up

You will need a new LCD put in. Laptop will not be very usable until you get that fixed. Just sayin

item.title: Labtop screen messed up
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Yeah that shit is cracked. You’re going to have to get it repaired (assumed you don’t have the knowledge to fix it yourself considering you can’t spell laptop correctly and wanted to know how long to leave it off for it to magically fix itself).

Read full topic
